name: Adapt Self
shortDesc: You make subtle changes to yourself to adapt to the situation.
desc:
You make subtle changes to yourself to adapt to the situation. Choose one of the following options that applies to you.

If you are in water, you gain a swim Speed equal to half your Speed.
If you are in water, you become able to breathe water.
If it's too dark for you to see, you gain darkvision.
If you are in an environment of severe heat or severe cold, you are protected from the effects of severe heat or severe cold, and the spell lasts 10 minutes.

name: Agile Feet
shortDesc: The blessings of your god make your feet faster and your movements more fluid.
duration: until the end of the current turn
desc: The blessings of your god make your feet faster and your movements more fluid. You gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speed and ignore difficult terrain. As part of casting agile feet, you can Stride or Step; you can instead Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim if you have the appropriate Speed.

name: Ancestral Memories
shortDesc: The memories of long-dead spellcasters grant you knowledge in a specific skill.
desc: The memories of long-dead spellcasters grant you knowledge in a specific skill. Choose any non-Lore skill, or a Lore skill related to the ancient empire from which your bloodline sprang. You temporarily become <var>var1</var> in that skill and might gain other memories associated with an ancestor who was trained in that skill. If you attempt a task or activity that lasts beyond this spell's duration, use the lower proficiency modifier.

heightened.desc: You temporarily become an expert in the skill you choose.

name: Angelic Halo
shortDesc: You gain an angelic halo with an aura that increases allies' healing from the heal spell.
desc: You gain an angelic halo with an aura that increases allies' healing from the heal spell. Allies in your halo's emanation who are healed by a heal spell gain a status bonus to Hit Points regained equal to double the heal spell's level.

name: Appearance of Wealth
shortDesc: You create a brief vision of immense wealth filling the spell's area.
desc: You create a brief vision of immense wealth filling the spell's area. Each creature within 20 feet of the area that could be enticed by material wealth must attempt a Will saving throw. A creature that enters the area automatically disbelieves the illusion, and disbelieving the illusion ends any fascinated condition imposed by the spell. As long as you Sustain the Spell, other creatures react to the treasure like they would any other illusion, but they are not at risk of becoming fascinated.
critsuccess: The creature disbelieves the illusion and is unaffected by it.
success: The creature is fascinated by the wealth until it has completed its first action on its next turn.
failure: The creature is fascinated by the illusion.

name: Athletic Rush
shortDesc: Your body fills with physical power and skill.
desc: Your body fills with physical power and skill. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to Speed and a +2 status bonus to Athletics checks. As a part of Casting this Spell, you can use a Stride, Leap, Climb, or Swim action. The spell's bonuses apply during that action.

name: Augment Summoning
shortDesc: You augment the abilities of a summoned creature.
desc: You augment the abilities of a summoned creature. The target gains a +1 status bonus to all checks (this also applies to the creature's DCs, including its AC) for the duration of its summoning, up to 1 minute.

name: Bit of Luck
shortDesc: You tilt the scales of luck slightly to protect a creature from disaster.
desc:
You tilt the scales of luck slightly to protect a creature from disaster. When the target would attempt a saving throw, it can roll twice and use the better result. Once it does this, the spell ends.

If you cast bit of luck again, any previous bit of luck you cast that's still in effect ends. After a creature has been targeted with bit of luck, it becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

name: Blind Ambition
shortDesc: You strengthen a target's ambition, increase its resentment of allies, and make its allegiances more susceptible to change.
desc: You strengthen a target's ambition, increase its resentment of allies, and make its allegiances more susceptible to change. The target must attempt a Will save.
success: The target takes a -1 status penalty to its saving throws and other defenses against attempts to Coerce it, Request something of it, or use mental effects to convince it to do something (such as a suggestion spell). This penalty applies only if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions.
failure: As success, but the penalty is -2.
critfailure: The target is overcome with ambition, taking whatever actions would advance its own agenda over those of anyone else, even without attempts to convince it.

name: Call of the Grave
shortDesc: You fire a ray of sickening energy.
desc: You fire a ray of sickening energy. Make a spell attack roll.
critsuccess: The target becomes sickened 2 and slowed 1 as long as it's sickened.
success: The target becomes sickened 1.
failure: The target is unaffected.

name: Charged Javelin
shortDesc: You fire a javelin of electricity that leaves a charged field around its target.
inputRequired: You can target any ally with the spell that should benefit from the target's vulnerability.
desc: You fire a javelin of electricity that leaves a charged field around its target. Make a spell attack roll. The javelin deals |dice=var1 Electricity| <var>var1</var> electricity damage and |dice=var2 Persistent Electricity| <var>var2</var> persistent electricity damage.
critsuccess: The javelin deals double damage, both initial and persistent.
success: The javelin deals full damage.
desc2: As long as the target is taking persistent damage from this spell, creatures gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with metal weapons or electricity effects against the target, and the target takes a -1 status penalty to saves against electricity effects.

heightened.desc: The initial damage increases by 1d6, and the persistent damage increases by 1.

name: Charming Touch
shortDesc: You infuse your target with attraction, causing it to act friendlier toward you.
targets: 1 creature that could find you attractive
desc: You infuse your target with attraction, causing it to act friendlier toward you. The target attempts a Will save. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this save if you or your allies recently threatened or were hostile to it.
critsuccess: The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.
success: The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charming touch, unless it identifies the spell (see Identifying Spells).
failure: The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you.
critfailure: The target is helpful and can't use hostile actions against you.
desc2: You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. After the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, which could potentially allow you to convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

name: Charming Words
shortDesc: You whisper enchanting words to deflect your foe's ire.
duration: until the start of your next turn
desc: You whisper enchanting words to deflect your foe's ire. The target must attempt a Will save.
success: The target takes a -1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls against you.
failure: The target can't use hostile actions against you.
critfailure: The target is stunned 1 and can't use hostile actions against you.

name: Cloak of Shadow
shortDesc: You drape the target in a mantle of swirling shadows that make it harder to see.
desc:
You drape the target in a mantle of swirling shadows that make it harder to see. The cloak reduces bright light within a 20-foot emanation to dim light. This is a form of magical darkness and can therefore overcome non-magical light or attempt to counteract magical light.

The target can use concealed condition gained from the shadows to Hide, though observant creatures can still follow the moving aura of shadow, making it difficult for the target to become completely undetected. The target can use an Interact action to remove the cloak and leave it behind as a decoy, where it remains, reducing light for the rest of the spell's duration. If anyone picks up the cloak after it's been removed by the original target, the cloak evaporates and the spell ends.

name: Counter Performance
shortDesc: Your performance protects you and your allies.
trigger: You or an ally within 60 feet rolls a saving throw against an auditory or visual effect.
desc: Your performance protects you and your allies. Roll a Performance check for a type you know: an auditory performance if the trigger was auditory, or a visual one for a visual trigger. You and allies in the area can use the better result between your Performance check and the saving throw.

name: Cry of Destruction
shortDesc: Your voice booms, smashing what's in front of you.
desc: Your voice booms, smashing what's in front of you. Each creature and unattended object in the area takes |dice=var1 Sonic| <var>var1</var> sonic damage. If you already dealt damage to an enemy this turn with a Strike or spell, increase the damage dice from this spell to |dice=var2 Sonic| d12s.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Dazzling Flash
shortDesc: You raise your religious symbol and create a blinding flash of light.
desc: <var>var1</var>You raise your religious symbol and create a blinding flash of light. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The creature is dazzled for 1 round.
failure: The creature is blinded for 1 round and dazzled for 1 minute. The creature can spend an Interact action rubbing its eyes to end the blinded condition.
critfailure: The creature is blinded for 1 round and dazzled for 1 hour.

heightened.desc: The area increases to a 30-foot cone.

descs.value: The area increases to a 30-foot cone.

name: Death's Call
shortDesc: Seeing another pass from this world to the next invigorates you.
inputRequired: Manually set the appropriate amount of temporary Hit Points after casting the spell. When the spell ends, all manually added Hit Points will be lost.
trigger: A living creature within 20 feet of you dies, or an undead creature within 20 feet of you is destroyed.
desc: Seeing another pass from this world to the next invigorates you. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to the triggering creature's level plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If the triggering creature was undead, double the number of temporary Hit Points you gain. These last for the duration of the spell, and the spell ends if all the temporary Hit Points are depleted earlier.

name: Delay Consequence
shortDesc: You transpose the moment that the target would be injured to later in its timestream.
trigger: A creature or object within range is hit by an attack.
desc: You transpose the moment that the target would be injured to later in its timestream. Roll damage normally, but do not reduce Hit Points or apply any other effects of the attack until the spell's duration has elapsed. When the spell ends, the target is immediately affected by the attack, taking damage and being affected by any additional effects. You can Dismiss this spell.

name: Diabolic Edict
shortDesc: You issue a diabolic edict, demanding the target perform a particular task and offering rewards for its fulfillment.
desc: You issue a diabolic edict, demanding the target perform a particular task and offering rewards for its fulfillment. It gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks related to performing the task. If it refuses to perform the task you proclaimed, it instead takes a -1 status penalty to all its attack rolls and skill checks.

name: Divine Plagues
shortDesc: Your deity sends wracking plagues.
desc: Your deity sends wracking plagues. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. When you Cast the Spell, decide whether the disease inflicts the clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition.
success: The target is unaffected.
failure: The target is afflicted with divine plague at stage 1.
critfailure: The target is afflicted with divine plague at stage 2.
desc2: Divine Plague (diseasevar1) Level 1; Stage 1 clumsy var2, enfeebled var2, or stupefied var2 (1 round); Stage 2 slowed 1 and clumsy var2, enfeebled var2, or stupefied var2 (1 round); Stage 3 clumsy var2, enfeebled var2, or stupefied var2 and the target can't recover from the condition until they are cured (1 day)

heightened.desc: The divine plague disease gains the virulent trait. The condition value for the clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition is 2 instead of 1.

name: Diviner's Sight
shortDesc: You glimpse into the target's future.
duration: until the end of your next turn
desc: You glimpse into the target's future. Roll a d20; when the target attempts a non-secret saving throw or skill check, it can use the number you rolled instead of rolling, and the spell ends. Alternatively, you can instead reveal the result of the die roll for one of the target's secret checks during the duration, and the spell ends. Casting it again ends any active diviner's sight you have cast, as well as any active diviner's sight on the target.

name: Draconic Barrage
shortDesc: You shape energy into one incorporeal tiny dragon (or serpentine creature) that flits around you.
desc: You shape energy into var1. The specific dragon is random; roll |dice=1d6| 1d6 on the table below for each dragon evoked to determine which type of dragon you create. While the spell persists, you can command one of your dragons to spit a missile of energy at a creature within 60 feet by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This is a ranged Strike that uses your spell attack bonus and deals |dice=var2 + spellMod| var2 damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier, with the damage type depending on the dragon. A dragon's breath Strike uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty. Once a dragon has used its breath Strike, it winks out of existence; when you have no dragons remaining, the spell ends. 1 Copper or black dragon, Acid breath 2 Silver or white dragon, Cold breath 3 Bronze or blue dragon, Electricity breath 4 Brass, gold, or red dragon, Fire breath 5 Green Dragon, Poison breath 6 Your choice of dragon, breath type as the dragon

heightened.desc: You shape 1 additional dragon, and the Strike damage increases by 1d6.

descs.value: one incorporeal tiny dragon (or serpentine creature) that flits around you.
two incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
three incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
four incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
five incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
six incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
seven incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
eight incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
nine incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.
ten incorporeal tiny dragons (or serpentine creatures) that flit around you.

name: Dragon Claws
shortDesc: Vicious claws grow from your fingers.
desc: Vicious claws grow from your fingers. They are finesse unarmed attacks that deal 1d4 slashing damage and var1 extra damage of a type determined by the dragon in your bloodline. Black and copper Acid Blue and bronze Electricity Brass, gold, or red Fire Green Poison Silver or white Cold Your scales from blood magic glow with faint energy, giving you resistance var2 to the same damage type.

heightened.desc: The extra damage increases to 2d6, and the resistance increases to 10.
The extra damage increases to 3d6, and the resistance increases to 15.

name: Eject Soul
shortDesc: Your touch disrupts the connection between body and soul, possibly forcing the soul out of the body altogether.
targets: 1 living creature that has a soul
desc: Your touch disrupts the connection between body and soul, possibly forcing the soul out of the body altogether. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. You can allow allies to choose the degree of success instead of rolling a saving throw.
success: The target is unaffected.
failure: The target is stunned 1 as its soul briefly loses its connection to its body.
critfailure: The target's soul exits its body for 1 round. <var>var1</var>The target's body becomes stunned. While its body is stunned in this way, the target remains fully aware in soul form; it simply can't consciously move its body (though the body makes basic instinctual defensive movements). The target's soul has the incorporeal trait, is invisible, and has a fly Speed of 60 feet. It can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body, and it must always maintain line of effect to its body. When the target's body ceases being stunned, the target's soul instantly returns to its body as the target wakes.

heightened.desc: If a willing ally chooses to critically fail, it can stay in soul form for 1 additional round.

descs.value: If a willing ally chooses to critically fail, it can stay in soul form for 2 rounds.
If a willing ally chooses to critically fail, it can stay in soul form for 3 rounds.
If a willing ally chooses to critically fail, it can stay in soul form for 4 rounds.

name: Elemental Toss
shortDesc: With a flick of your wrist, you fling a chunk of your elemental matter at your foe.
desc: With a flick of your wrist, you fling a chunk of your elemental matter at your foe. Make a spell attack roll, dealing |dice=var1 B| <var>var1</var> bludgeoning damage (or fire damage if your element is fire) on a success, and double damage on a critical success. This spell has your element's trait.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Empty Inside
shortDesc: You inject a sliver of the void into your mind, momentarily remaking it into a bleak and empty place.
inputRequired: Attempt a counteract check against the appropriate number of emotion effects affecting you.
desc: You inject a sliver of the void into your mind, momentarily remaking it into a bleak and empty place. Attempt a counteract check against <var>var1</var> affecting you.

heightened.desc: You can attempt counteract checks against any number of emotion effects affecting you.

name: Face in the Crowd
shortDesc: While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance becomes bland and nondescript.
inputRequired: Until 3rd Level, you should only target yourself with Face in the Crowd
desc: <var>var1</var>While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance becomes bland and nondescript. You gain a +2 status bonus to Deception and Stealth checks to go unnoticed among the crowd, and you ignore difficult terrain caused by the crowd.

heightened.desc: The spell gains a range of 10 feet and can target up to 10 creatures.

descs.value: The spell gains a range of 10 feet and can target up to 10 creatures.

name: Faerie Dust
shortDesc: You sprinkle magical dust in the spell's area, making those within easier to trick.
desc: <var>var1</var>You sprinkle magical dust in the spell's area, making those within easier to trick. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save. For each additional action you use Casting the Spell, the burst's radius increases by 5 feet.
success: The creature is unaffected.
failure: The creature can't use reactions and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves.
critfailure: As failure, and the creature also takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.

heightened.desc: The initial radius increases by 5 feet.

name: Fire Ray
shortDesc: A blazing band of fire arcs through the air.
desc: A blazing band of fire arcs through the air. Make a spell attack roll. The ray deals |dice=var1 Fire|<var>var1</var> fire damage.
critsuccess: The ray deals double damage and |dice=var2 Persistent Fire| <var>var2 Persistent Fire</var> persistent fire damage.
success: The ray deals full damage.

heightened.desc: The ray's initial damage increases by 2d6, and the persistent fire damage on a critical success increases by 1d4.

name: Force Bolt
shortDesc: You fire an unerring dart of force from your fingertips.
desc: You fire an unerring dart of force from your fingertips. It automatically hits and deals |dice=var1 Force| <var>var1</var> force damage to the target.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d4+1.

name: Forced Quiet
shortDesc: You quiet the target's voice, preventing it from giving away valuable secrets.
desc: You quiet the target's voice, preventing it from giving away valuable secrets. This doesn't prevent the target from talking or providing verbal spell components, but no creature more than 10 feet away can hear its whispers without succeeding at a Perception check against your spell DC, which might interfere with auditory or linguistic effects as well as communication. The spell's duration depends on the target's Fortitude save. After attempting its save, the target becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.
success: The duration is 1 round.
failure: The duration is 1 minute.
critfailure: The duration is 10 minutes.

name: Glutton's Jaw
shortDesc: Your mouth transforms into a shadowy maw bristling with pointed teeth.
desc: Your mouth transforms into a shadowy maw bristling with pointed teeth. These jaws are an unarmed attack with the forceful trait dealing 1d8 piercing damage. If you hit with your jaws and deal damage, you gain |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> temporary Hit Points.

heightened.desc: The temporary Hit Points increase by 1d6.

name: Goodberry
shortDesc: You imbue the target berry with the bounty of nature, allowing it to heal and sustain far beyond its normal capacity.
desc: <var>var1</var>You imbue the target berry with the bounty of nature, turning it into a goodberry that can heal and sustain far beyond its normal capacity. A creature can eat the goodberry with an Interact action to regain |dice=1d6 + 4| 1d6+4 Hit Points. A berry not consumed during the duration withers away. Every six goodberries consumed gives as much nourishment as one square meal for a typical human.

heightened.desc: You can target an additional berry. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.

descs.value: You can target two berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target three berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target four berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target five berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target six berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target seven berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target eight berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target nine berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.
You can target ten berries. A creature can consume any number of goodberries from the same casting with a single Interact action.

name: Hand of the Apprentice
shortDesc: You hurl a held melee weapon, making a spell attack roll.
desc: You hurl a held melee weapon with which you are trained at the target, making a spell attack roll. On a success, you deal the weapon's damage as if you had hit with a melee Strike, but adding your spellcasting ability modifier to damage, rather than your Strength modifier. On a critical success, you deal double damage, and you add the weapon's critical specialization effect. Regardless of the outcome, the weapon flies back to you and returns to your hand.

name: Heal Animal
shortDesc: You heal an animal's wounds.
desc: You heal an animal's wounds, restoring |dice=var1| var1 Hit Points to the target. The number of actions spent Casting this Spell determines its effect. somatic The spell has a range of touch. somatic, verbal The spell has a range of 30 feet and restores an additional |dice=var1 + var2| var2 Hit Points to the target.

heightened.desc: The amount of healing increases by 1d8, and the additional healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

name: Healer's Blessing
shortDesc: Your words bless a creature with an enhanced connection to positive energy.
desc:
Your words bless a creature with an enhanced connection to positive energy. When the target regains Hit Points from a healing spell, it regains |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> additional Hit Points.

The target regains additional Hit Points from healer's blessing only the first time it regains HP from a given healing spell, so a spell that heals the creature repeatedly over a duration would restore additional Hit Points only once.

heightened.desc: The additional healing increases by 2 HP.

name: Hurtling Stone
shortDesc: You evoke a magical stone and throw it, with your god's presence guiding your aim.
desc: You evoke a magical stone and throw it, with your god's presence guiding your aim. Make a spell attack roll against the target. The stone deals bludgeoning damage equal to |dice=var1 + strmod B| <var>var1</var> plus your Strength modifier.
success: The stone deals full damage.

heightened.desc: The stone's damage increases by 1d6.

name: Hyperfocus
shortDesc: You sharpen a creature's senses, though more distant objects become hazy, indistinct, or muted to it.
desc: <var>var1</var>You sharpen a creature's senses, though more distant objects become hazy, indistinct, or muted to it. The target gains a +1 status bonus to Perception checks attempted with any of its precise senses. Furthermore, any imprecise senses the target has are sharpened to precise senses (though they do not receive the status bonus). However, the target cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 20 feet with any of its senses. The duration is determined by the target's Will save. You can allow allies to choose the outcome instead of rolling a saving throw.
success: The target is affected for 1 round.
failure: The target is affected for 1 minute.
critfailure: As failure, but the target cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 10 feet.

heightened.desc: You can target up to 2 creatures.
You can target up to 4 creatures.

descs.value: You can target up to 2 creatures.
You can target up to 4 creatures.

name: Inspire Competence
shortDesc: Your encouragement inspires your ally to succeed at a task.
desc:
Your encouragement inspires your ally to succeed at a task. This counts as having taken sufficient preparatory actions to Aid your ally on a skill check of your choice, regardless of the circumstances. When you later use the Aid reaction, you can roll Performance instead of the normal skill check, and if you roll a failure, you get a success instead. If you are legendary in Performance, you automatically critically succeed.

The GM might rule that you can't use this ability if the act of encouraging your ally would interfere with the skill check (such as a check to Sneak quietly or maintain a disguise).

name: Inspire Courage
shortDesc: Your performance protects you and your allies.
desc: You inspire your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

name: Jealous Hex
shortDesc: You draw forth a hag's innate jealousy to deny a target its greatest attribute.
desc: You draw forth a hag's innate jealousy to deny a target its greatest attribute. This is a curse and can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses. The target gains an adverse condition depending on its highest ability modifier: Strength (enfeebled); Dexterity (clumsy); Constitution (drained); or Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (stupefied). On a tie, the creature decides which of the conditions associated with the tied ability modifiers to take. The target must attempt a Will save.
success: The target is unaffected.
failure: The condition's value is 1.
critfailure: The condition's value is 2.
desc2: At the start of each of your turns, the target can attempt another Will save, ending the effect on a success.

name: Ki Rush
shortDesc: Accelerated by your ki, you move with such speed you become a blur.
desc: Accelerated by your ki, you move with such speed you become a blur. Move two times: two Strides, two Steps, or one Stride and one Step (in either order). You gain the concealed condition during this movement and until the start of your next turn.

name: Ki Strike
shortDesc: You focus your ki into magical attacks.
desc: You focus your ki into magical attacks. Make an unarmed Strike or Flurry of Blows (this doesn't change the limit on using only one flourish per turn). You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls with the Strikes, and the Strikes deal |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> extra damage. This damage can be any of the following types of your choice, chosen each time you Strike: force, lawful (only if you're lawful), negative, or positive.

heightened.desc: The extra damage increases by 1d6.

name: Lament
shortDesc: You let out your negative emotions in a guttural wail that shakes your enemies' hearts and deals 1d8 mental damage (basic Will save).
desc: You let out your negative emotions in a guttural wail that shakes your enemies' hearts and deals |dice=var1 Mental| <var>var1</var> mental damage (basic Will save). If you have any harmful conditions imposed by emotion effects, lament deals additional mental damage equal to the counteract level of the highest-level effect.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Lay on Hands
shortDesc: Your hands become infused with positive energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch.
desc: Your hands become infused with positive energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch. If you use lay on hands on a willing living target, you restore |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round. Against an undead target, you deal |dice=var2| <var>var2</var> damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

heightened.desc: The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.

name: Lift Nature's Caul
shortDesc: With a wave of the hand, you cause the targets to see the world around them as if a gauzy film had been lifted away to expose the truth that lies below their perceived reality.
inputRequired: You can target all allies with the spell that should be bolstered by it to grant them the bonus.
desc:
<var>var1</var>With a wave of the hand, you cause the targets to see the world around them as if a gauzy film had been lifted away to expose the truth that lies below their perceived reality. Natural features they can see grow twisted and horrendous, structures appear distorted and ruined, and objects seem warped and alien. This alternate vision fades quickly, but the glimpse beyond the natural world lingers for the spell's duration.

Aberrations or worshippers of Outer Gods or Great Old Ones are bolstered by this vision of warped reality and gain a +1 status bonus to Will saving throws and attack rolls for 1 minute, while all other creatures must attempt a Will saving throw.
critsuccess: The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour.
success: The creature is sickened 1.
failure: The creature is stupefied 1 for <var>var2</var> and frightened 1.
critfailure: The creature is stupefied 1 for <var>var2</var> and frightened 2. It can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 as long as it remains stupefied by this spell.

heightened.desc: You increase the area by 5 feet and the duration of the stupefied condition by 1 minute.

descs.value: You increase the area by 5 feet.
You increase the area by 5 feet.
You increase the area by 5 feet.
You increase the area by 5 feet.

name: Lingering Composition
shortDesc: You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits.
inputRequired: The next spell you cast with a duration will last for the selected duration, unless its duration is longer. Choose a suitable spell matching the description.
desc: You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits. If your next action is to cast a cantrip composition with a duration of 1 round, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a standard-difficulty DC of a level equal to the highest-level target of your composition, but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The effect depends on the result of your check.
success: The composition lasts 3 rounds.
failure: The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.

name: Loremaster's Etude
shortDesc: You call upon your muse's deep mysteries, granting the target a greater ability to think and recall information.
inputRequired: The target may roll the triggering Recall Knowledge skill check twice and use the better result.
trigger: You or an ally within range attempts a skill check to Recall Knowledge
desc: You call upon your muse's deep mysteries, granting the target a greater ability to think and recall information. Roll the triggering Recall Knowledge skill check twice and use the better result.

name: Magic's Vessel
shortDesc: A creature becomes a receptacle for pure magical energy sent by your deity.
desc: A creature becomes a receptacle for pure magical energy sent by your deity. The target gains a +1 status bonus to saving throws. Each time you Cast a Spell from your spell slots, you automatically Sustain this Spell and grant its target resistance to damage from spells until the start of your next turn. This resistance is equal to the level of the spell you cast.

name: Moonbeam
shortDesc: You shine a ray of moonlight.
desc: You shine a ray of moonlight. Make a spell attack roll. The beam of light deals |dice=var1 Fire| <var>var1</var> fire damage. Moonbeam deals silver damage for the purposes of weaknesses, resistances, and the like.
critsuccess: The beam deals double damage, and the target is dazzled for 1 minute.
success: The beam deals full damage, and the target is dazzled for 1 round.

heightened.desc: The ray's damage increases by 1d6.

name: Oathkeeper's Insignia
shortDesc: A magical indicator assures a creature that you've upheld your end of a bargain.
trigger: You make a promise or deal.
desc: <var>var1</var>A magical indicator assures a creature that you've upheld your end of a bargain. When you Cast the Spell, you create a bracelet, flower, or other such trinket. If, while the spell persists, you complete the terms of the promise or deal you made, the trinket fades away with a pleasant chime; if you violate the terms instead, the trinket breaks with a dissonant crash.

heightened.desc: The duration becomes 1 day.
The duration becomes 1 week.
The duration becomes 1 month.
The duration becomes 1 year.

name: Object Memory
shortDesc: By touching an object, you draw forth the experience of those who created and used it.
desc: By touching an object, you draw forth the experience of those who created and used it. If you touch a weapon, your proficiency rank with that weapon temporarily increases to <var>var1</var> (if it is not already higher). If you touch a tool, your proficiency rank with the next skill check you attempt with that tool (such as a Crafting check with a blacksmith's hammer) within the spell's duration temporarily increases to <var>var1</var> (if it is not already higher). This spell has no benefit for activities that take longer than a minute to complete.

heightened.desc: Your proficiency rank increases to expert instead of trained.

name: Overstuff
shortDesc: Huge amounts of food and drink fill the target.
desc: Huge amounts of food and drink fill the target. It receives a full meal's worth of nourishment and must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The target is sickened 1, but if it spends an action to end the condition, it succeeds automatically.
failure: The target is sickened 1.
critfailure: The target is sickened 2.
desc2: A target sickened by this spell takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it's no longer sickened.

name: Parch
shortDesc: Dry winds dehydrate a creature.
desc: <var>var1</var>Dry winds dehydrate a creature. The target must attempt a Fortitude save; if used on a creature with the water trait or a creature made primarily of liquid (such as many oozes), the creature uses the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as earth elementals) are immune to parch.
success: The target takes a -1 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 round.
failure: The target takes a -1 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 minute.
critfailure: The target takes a -2 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 minute and is dazzled as long as it has this penalty.
desc2: If a creature affected by parch drinks a liquid, such as a swig of water or a potion, the spell ends. Affected creatures that have the water trait or are made primarily of liquid, as well as affected creatures that can't drink, can end the effect as a two-action activity, which has the concentrate trait.

heightened.desc: You can target up to 4 creatures.

descs.value: You can target up to 4 creatures.

name: Perfected Mind
shortDesc: You meditate upon perfection to remove all distractions from your mind.
inputRequired: Attempt a new Will save against one mental effect currently affecting you that required a Will save.
desc: You meditate upon perfection to remove all distractions from your mind. Attempt a new Will save against one mental effect currently affecting you that required a Will save. Use the result of this new save to determine the outcome of the mental effect, unless the new save would have a worse result than the original save, in which case nothing happens. You can use perfected mind against a given effect only once.

name: Physical Boost
shortDesc: You temporarily improve the target's physique.
duration: until the end of the target's next turn
desc: You temporarily improve the target's physique. The target gains a +2 status bonus to the next Acrobatics check, Athletics check, Fortitude save, or Reflex save it attempts.

name: Practice Makes Perfect
shortDesc: The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City
trigger: You or an ally within range fails a skill check for a skill in which you or they are trained.
desc: The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill. This bonus can change the outcome of the target's check.

name: Protective Ward
shortDesc: You emanate a shimmering aura of protective magic.
desc: You emanate a shimmering aura of protective magic. You and any allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC. Each time you Sustain the Spell, the emanation's radius increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 30 feet.

name: Protector's Sacrifice
shortDesc: You protect your ally by suffering in their stead.
trigger: An ally within 30 feet takes damage.
desc:
You protect your ally by suffering in their stead. Reduce the damage the triggering ally would take by |dice=var1 |<var>var1</var>. You redirect this damage to yourself, but your immunities, weaknesses, resistances and so on do not apply.

You aren't subject to any conditions or other effects of whatever damaged your ally (such as poison from a venomous bite). Your ally is still subject to those effects even if you redirect all of the triggering damage to yourself.

heightened.desc: The damage you redirect increases by 3.

name: Pushing Gust
shortDesc: Giving the air a push, you buffet the target with a powerful gust of wind; it must attempt a Fortitude save.
desc: Giving the air a push, you buffet the target with a powerful gust of wind; it must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The target is pushed 5 feet away from you.
failure: The target is pushed 10 feet away from you.
critfailure: The target is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked prone.

name: Read Fate
shortDesc: You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.
desc:
You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.

You learn a single enigmatic word connected to the creature's fate in that time frame. Fate is notoriously inscrutable, and the word isn't necessarily meant to be taken at face value, so the meaning is often clear only in hindsight. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. If the creature's fate is too uncertain, or on a failed flat check, the spell yields the word "inconclusive." Either way, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

name: Redact
shortDesc: You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents.
targets: unattended written materials of up to 1 Bulk or less
desc: <var>var2</var>You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents. When you cast the spell, give one proper name, be it a creature, location, or object. Any mention of that name within the document becomes blurred, smudged, or otherwise completely illegible. Epithets and unambiguous references to the name are redacted as well; for instance, redacting the name of the goddess Sarenrae from a book would also remove references to her title "the Dawnflower."<var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: Instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or Society check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn't tell them what the original said.
At your choice, the duration is unlimited.

descs.value: Alternatively, instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or Society check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn't tell them what the original said.

Alternatively, instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or Society check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn't tell them what the original said.
At your choice, the duration is unlimited.

name: Savor the Sting
shortDesc: You inflict pain upon the target and revel in their anguish.
desc: You inflict pain upon the target and revel in their anguish. This deals |dice=var1 Mental| <var>var1</var> mental damage and |dice=var1 Persistent Mental| <var>var1</var> persistent mental damage; the target must attempt a Will save. As long as the target is taking persistent damage from this spell, you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks against the target.
success: The target takes half damage and no persistent damage.
failure: The target takes full initial and persistent damage.
critfailure: The target takes double initial and persistent damage.

heightened.desc: The initial damage increases by 1d4 and the persistent damage increases by 1d4.

name: Scholarly Recollection
shortDesc: Speaking a short prayer as you gather your thoughts, you're blessed to find that your deity gave you just the right bit of information for your situation.
trigger: You attempt a Perception check to Seek, or you attempt a skill check to Recall Knowledge with a skill you're trained in.
desc: Speaking a short prayer as you gather your thoughts, you're blessed to find that your deity gave you just the right bit of information for your situation. Roll the triggering check twice and use the better result.

name: Share Burden
shortDesc: You shoulder some of your ally's pain.
inputRequired: Grant yourself the appropriate condition, if needed.
trigger: An ally within 30 feet is about to attempt a saving throw against a harmful emotion effect, and you would not otherwise have to save against the effect.
desc: You shoulder some of your ally's pain. Both you and your ally use the outcome one degree of success better than the result of your ally's saving throw, even if the triggering effect usually affects only one target.

name: Silver's Refrain
shortDesc: Make weapons silver and impede a devil's teleportation.
desc:
The "Song of Silver" was an enchanted song used by the Silver Ravens to battle diabolic forces. You pull from select verses to temporarily replicate some of the legendary song's benefits, albeit on a much smaller scale.

Weapon and unarmed attacks by allies in the area are treated as silver. In addition, this spell automatically attempts to counteract any dimension door cast by a devil within the area or cast by a devil attempting to enter the area using dimension door. If a devil attempts to enter the area using dimension door and the spell is counteracted, the devil remains where it started.

name: Soothing Words
shortDesc: You attempt to calm the target by uttering soothing words in a calm and even tone.
inputRequired: When you Cast this Spell, you can attempt to counteract one emotion effect on the target.
desc:
You attempt to calm the target by uttering soothing words in a calm and even tone. The target gains a <var>var1</var> status bonus to Will saving throws. This bonus increases to <var>var2</var> against emotion effects.

In addition, when you Cast this Spell, you can attempt to counteract one emotion effect on the target.

heightened.desc: The bonus to saves increases to +2, or +3 against emotion effects.

name: Splash of Art
shortDesc: A deluge of colorful illusory paint, tools, or other symbols of art and artisanship drift down in the area.
desc: A deluge of colorful illusory paint, tools, or other symbols of art and artisanship drift down in the area. Roll 1d4 to determine the color of the illusion. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save. A creature is unaffected on a success. On a failure or critical failure, the creature takes the results listed on the table relevant to the color. 1 White: Dazzled for 1 round on failure or Dazzled for 1 minute on critical failure 2 Red: Enfeebled 1 for 1 round on failure or Enfeebled 2 for 1 round on critical failure 3 Yellow: Frightened 1 on failure or Frightened 2 on critical failure 4 Blue: Clumsy 1 for 1 round on failure or Clumsy 2 for 1 round on critical failure

name: Split the Tongue
shortDesc: The deceiving creature's tongue splits like a serpent's tongue.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale
trigger: A creature within 30 feet fails a Deception or Diplomacy check.
desc: The deceiving creature's tongue splits like a serpent's tongue. The creature takes |dice=var1 S| <var>var1</var> slashing damage and must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The creature takes half damage.
failure: The creature takes full damage and is stupefied 1 for 1d4 rounds.
critfailure: As failure, but the creature takes double damage and is stupefied 2 for 1d4 rounds.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d8.

name: Sudden Shift
shortDesc: You swiftly move from a dangerous spot and veil yourself.
trigger: An enemy misses you with a melee attack.
duration: until the end of your next turn
desc: You swiftly move from a dangerous spot and veil yourself. You Step and become concealed.

name: Swarmsense
shortDesc: You extend your senses through a multitude of crawling and flying creatures.
desc: You extend your senses through a multitude of crawling and flying creatures. You create a crawling swarm in your square.<var>var1</var> You can hear through the swarm as if using your normal auditory senses<var>var2</var>. The first time you Sustain the Spell each round, you can move the swarm 10 feet along the ground in any direction. The swarm has AC 15 and a +0 bonus to its saves. Any damage dealt to the swarm destroys it and ends the spell.

heightened.desc: The swarm has the benefits of spider climb.
The swarm has a fly Speed of 10 feet. You can see through the swarm using your visual senses.
The swarm gains a 10-foot status bonus to its Speeds.

descs.value: The swarm has the benefits of spider climb.
The swarm has the benefits of spider climb and a fly Speed of 10 feet.
and see through the swarm using your visual senses
The swarm has the benefits of spider climb and a fly Speed of 10 feet, and gains a 10-foot status bonus to all its Speeds.
and see through the swarm using your visual senses

name: Sweet Dream
shortDesc: With soothing song or tales, you lull the target into an enchanting dream.
desc: With soothing song or tales, you lull the target into an enchanting dream. When you cast the spell, the target falls unconscious if it wasn't already. While unconscious, it experiences a dream of your choice. If it sleeps for at least 1 minute, it gains the benefit of the dream for the remainder of the spell's duration. Dream of Insight +1 status bonus to Intelligence-based skill checks Dream of Glamour +1 status bonus to Charisma-based skill checks Dream of Voyaging +5-foot status bonus to Speed If you Cast this Spell again, the effects of any previous sweet dream you cast end.

name: Tempest Surge
shortDesc: You surround a foe in a swirling storm of violent winds, roiling clouds, and crackling lightning.
desc: You surround a foe in a swirling storm of violent winds, roiling clouds, and crackling lightning. The storm deals |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> electricity damage. The target must attempt a basic Reflex save. On a failure, the target also is clumsy 2 for 1 round and takes <var>var2</var> persistent electricity damage.

heightened.desc: The initial damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage on a failure increases by 1.

name: Tentacular Limbs
shortDesc: Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms (such as fist and claw Strikes) to 10 feet.
desc: Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms (such as fist and claw Strikes) to 10 feet. This doesn't change the reach of your melee weapon attacks. During the duration, whenever you Cast a Spell, you can add an additional action to that spell's casting to temporarily extend your reach to <var>var1</var> feet to deliver that spell.

heightened.desc: When you add an additional action to a spell to temporarily extend your reach, your reach increases by an additional 10 feet to deliver that spell.

name: Tidal Surge
shortDesc: You call forth a tremendous wave to move the target either in a body of water or on the ground.
desc: You call forth a tremendous wave to move the target either in a body of water or on the ground. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.
failure: You move the target 5 feet in any direction along the ground or 10 feet in any direction through a body of water.
critfailure: You move the target up to 10 feet in any direction along the ground or 20 feet in any direction through a body of water.

name: Touch of Obedience
shortDesc: Your imperious touch erodes the target's willpower, making it easier to control.
desc: Your imperious touch erodes the target's willpower, making it easier to control. The target attempts a Will save.
success: The target is stupefied 1 until the end of your current turn.
failure: The target is stupefied 1 until the end of your next turn.
critfailure: The target is stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

name: Touch of Undeath
shortDesc: You attack the target's life force with undeath, dealing 1d6 negative damage.
desc: You attack the target's life force with undeath, dealing |dice=var1 Negative|<var>var1</var> negative damage. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The target takes half damage.
failure: The target takes full damage, and positive effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 round.
critfailure: The target takes double damage, and positive effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 minute.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d6.

name: Undeath's Blessing
shortDesc: You instill within a creature the touch of the grave.
desc:
You instill within a creature the touch of the grave. For the duration, harm spells treat the creature as undead and heal spells treat the creature as living. In addition, harm spells gain a <var>var1</var> status bonus to the Hit Points restored to the target.

If the target wishes to avoid the spell, it can attempt a Will save to reduce the effects
success: The target heals half as much from heal and takes half as much damage from harm for 1 round.
failure: Effects as described in the text.

heightened.desc: The status bonus to the Hit Points restored increases by 2.

name: Unimpeded Stride
shortDesc: Nothing can hold you in place.
desc: Nothing can hold you in place. You immediately escape from every magical effect that has you immobilized or grabbed unless the effect is of a higher level than your unimpeded stride spell. You then Stride. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain and any circumstance or status penalties to your Speed.

name: Veil of Confidence
shortDesc: You surround yourself in a veil of confidence.
desc: You surround yourself in a veil of confidence. You reduce your current frightened condition by 1, and whenever you would become frightened during the duration, reduce the amount by 1. If you critically fail a save against fear, veil of confidence ends immediately, and you increase any frightened condition you gain from the critical failure by 1 instead of decreasing it.

name: Vibrant Thorns
shortDesc: Your body sprouts a coat of brambly thorns that harm those that strike you and thrive on life magic.
desc: Your body sprouts a coat of brambly thorns that harm those that strike you and thrive on life magic. Adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that hit you with unarmed attacks, take |dice=var1 P| <var>var1</var> piercing damage each time they do. Anytime you cast a positive spell, the damage from your thorns increases to |dice=var2 P| <var>var2</var> until the start of your next turn.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1, or 1d6 after you cast a positive spell.

name: Waking Nightmare
shortDesc: You fill the creature's mind with a terrifying vision out of its nightmares.
desc:
You fill the creature's mind with a terrifying vision out of its nightmares. The target must attempt a Will save.

If the target is unconscious when you Cast this Spell on it, it immediately wakes up before attempting its save, and if it fails its save, it gains the fleeing condition for 1 round in addition to the effects noted below.
success: The target is frightened 1.
failure: The target is frightened 2.
critfailure: The target is frightened 3.

name: Warped Terrain
shortDesc: You create illusory hazards that cover all surfaces in the area.
desc: You create illusory hazards that cover all surfaces in the area (typically the ground). <var>var1</var>Any creature moving through the illusion treats the squares as difficult terrain. A creature can attempt to disbelieve the effect as normal after using a Seek action or otherwise spending actions interacting with the illusion. If it successfully disbelieves, it ignores the effect for the remaining duration. For each additional action you use casting the spell, the burst's radius increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 10 extra feet for 3 actions.

heightened.desc: You can make the illusion appear in the air rather than on a surface, causing it to function as difficult terrain for flying creatures.

descs.value: You can make the illusion appear in the air rather than on a surface, causing it to function as difficult terrain for flying creatures.

name: Weapon Surge
shortDesc: Holding your weapon aloft, you fill it with divine energy.
desc:
Holding your weapon aloft, you fill it with divine energy. On your next Strike with that weapon before the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 status bonus to the attack roll and the weapon deals an additional die of damage. If the weapon has a striking rune, this instead increases the number of dice from the striking rune by 1 (to a maximum of 3 extra weapon dice).

If the target weapon leaves your possession, weapon surge immediately ends.

name: Wild Morph
shortDesc: You morph your body based on your training, choosing one of the following effects based on your wild order feats.
inputRequired: If you choose multiple effects, cast the spell multiple times and restore the appropriate amount of focus points.
desc: var1You morph your body based on your training, choosing one of the following effects based on your wild order feats. If you have Wild Shape, you can morph your hands into wild claws. Your hands transform into incredibly sharp claws. These claws are an unarmed attack you're trained in and deal 1d6 slashing damage each (agile, finesse). var2You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you cannot hold an item while attacking. If you have Insect Shape, you can instead transform your mouth into wild jaws, an unarmed attack you're trained in that deals 1d8 piercing damagevar3. If you have Elemental Shape, you can morph your body to be partially composed of elemental matter, granting you resistance 5 to critical hits and precision damage. If you have Plant Shape, you can morph your arms into long vines, increasing your reach to 10 feet (or 15 feet with a reach weapon). If you have Soaring Shape, you can cast the spell as a two-action activity ( somatic, verbal) to grow wings from your back. These wings allow you to fly with a fly Speed of 30 feet.

heightened.desc: You can choose up to two of the effects from the list. Wild claws leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and wild jaws are envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.
You can choose up to three of the effects from the list. Wild claws deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and wild jaws deal 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.

descs.value: You can choose up to two of the effects from the list.
They leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit.
and is envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.
You can choose up to three of the effects from the list.
They leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit.
and is envenomed, also dealing 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.

name: Wild Shape
shortDesc: You infuse yourself with primal essence and transform yourself into another form.
desc: You infuse yourself with primal essence and transform yourself into another form. You can polymorph into any form listed in pest form, which lasts 10 minutes. <var>var1</var>All other wild shape forms last 1 minute. You can add more forms to your wild shape list with druid feats; your feat might grant you some or all of the forms from a given polymorph spell. When you transform into a form granted by a spell, you gain all the effects of the form you chose from a version of the spell heightened to wild shape's level. Wild shape allows you to use your own shapeshifting training more easily than most polymorph spells. When you choose to use your own attack modifier while polymorphed instead of the form's default attack modifier, you gain a +2 status bonus to your attack rolls.

heightened.desc: You can also wild shape into the forms listed in animal form.

descs.value: You can also wild shape into the forms listed in animal form, which lasts 1 minute.

name: Winter Bolt
shortDesc: You fling a hollow icicle filled with winter's wrath.
desc: You fling a hollow icicle filled with winter's wrath. Make a spell attack against a target within range. The bolt deals |dice=var1 P| <var>var1</var> piercing damage and lodges in the target. At the end of the target's next turn, the bolt shatters, releasing a whirl of snow and ice that deals |dice=var2 Cold| <var>var2</var> cold damage to the target and all adjacent creatures. The bolt can be removed with an Interact action, which causes it to melt harmlessly without detonating.
critsuccess: The initial bolt deals full damage and is especially well anchored, taking 2 Interact actions to remove. The bolt's explosion deals double damage.
success: The bolt and its explosion deal full damage.

heightened.desc: The initial damage increases by 1d8 and the secondary damage increases by 1d12.

name: Withering Grasp
shortDesc: Your touch rots organic material and decays objects.
PFSnote: The Targets entry for withering grasp should be "1 creature or unattended object", not "1 creature or object." When used on an unattended object, the object takes persistent damage on your next turn.
desc: Your touch rots organic material and decays objects. Make a melee spell attack roll. Your touch deals |dice=var1 Negative| <var>var1</var> negative damage plus |dice=var2 Persistent Negative| <var>var2</var> persistent negative damage. If a creature uses an item to block withering grasp, such as with the Shield Block reaction, the item is automatically affected, but the creature does not take damage (even if there is damage left over after the shield's Hardness). Unlike normal negative damage, the negative damage from withering grasp damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.
critsuccess: Your touch deals double damage (both initial and persistent). If you target an object, lower its Hardness by <var>var3</var> for 1 minute.
success: Your touch deals full damage. If you target an object, lower its Hardness by <var>var4</var> for 1 minute.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d12 and the persistent damage increases by 1. If you target an object, lower its Hardness by an additional 1 point on both a success and a critical success.

name: Word of Truth
shortDesc: You speak a statement you believe to be true and that is free of any attempt to deceive through twisting words, omission, and so on.
desc:
You speak a statement you believe to be true and that is free of any attempt to deceive through twisting words, omission, and so on. The statement must be 25 words or fewer. A symbol of your deity glows above your head, and anyone who sees you and hears your statement knows that you believe it to be true.

Each time you Sustain this Spell, you can repeat this effect.

name: Zenith Star
shortDesc: You call a tiny star to orbit a creature in a sparkling halo before shooting up into the heavens, where it marks the creature's rough location.
desc: <var>var1</var>You call a tiny star to orbit a creature in a sparkling halo before shooting up into the heavens, where it marks the creature's rough location. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The target is dazzled for 1 round.
failure: The target is dazzled for 1 round. While the spell persists, as long as you can see the night sky and the target is visible from the same night sky, you can sense the approximate direction and distance to the creature by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This is exact enough to track the creature, but not pinpoint their exact square (for instance, to make an attack). You can set a number of zenith stars equal to your Wisdom modifier; if you exceed this number, your oldest zenith star is automatically Dismissed.
critfailure: As failure, but the target is blinded for 1 round.

heightened.desc: The duration increases by 1 day.
You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.

descs.value: The duration increases to 4 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 5 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 6 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 7 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 8 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 9 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.
The duration increases to 10 days. You ignore the concealed condition against targets marked by zenith star.

name: Inspire Defense
shortDesc: You inspire your allies to protect themselves more effectively.
desc: You inspire your allies to protect themselves more effectively. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws, as well as resistance equal to half the spell's level to physical damage.

name: Triple Time
shortDesc: You dance at a lively tempo, speeding your allies' movement.
desc: You dance at a lively tempo, speeding your allies' movement. You and all allies in the area gain a +10-foot status bonus to all Speeds for 1 round.

name: Wholeness of Body
shortDesc: You focus your ki to heal yourself.
desc:
You heal yourself in one of the following ways, chosen by you when you cast the spell.

You regain |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> Hit Points.
You attempt to cure one poison or disease afflicting you; attempt to counteract the affliction.

Regardless of the result of its save, each target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. You can increase the number of actions it takes to Cast the Spell (to a maximum of 3 actions total). For each additional action, increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet, to a maximum of 10 extra feet for 3 actions.

failure: The target is stupefied 2.

name: Angelic Wings

desc: <var>var1</var>Wings of pure light spread out from your back, granting you a fly Speed equal to your Speed. Your wings cast bright light in a 30-foot radius. When this spell's duration would end, if you're still flying, you float to the ground, as feather fall.

name: Dirge of Doom

area: 30-foot cone or 60-foot line originating from you
desc: You spew energy from your mouth, dealing |dice=var1| var1 damage. The area, damage type, and save depend on the dragon type in your bloodline. Black and copper dragon 60-foot line of acid, Reflex save Blue and bronze dragon 60-foot line of electricity, Reflex save Brass dragon 60-foot line of fire, Reflex save Green dragon 30-foot cone of poison, Fortitude save Gold or red dragon 30-foot cone of fire, Reflex save Silver or white dragon 30-foot cone of cold, Reflex save

name: Drain Life
shortDesc: You close your hand and pull life energy from another creature into yourself.
desc: You close your hand and pull life energy from another creature into yourself. This deals |dice=var1 Negative| <var>var1</var> negative damage; the target must attempt a basic Fortitude save. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to the damage the target takes, after resolving its save and applying your blood magic if applicable. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage you dealt, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead. The temporary Hit Points last for 1 minute.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d4.

name: Elemental Motion
shortDesc: You call upon your element to propel you, improving your Speed depending on your element.
desc: You call upon your element to propel you, improving your Speed depending on your element. var1This spell has your element's trait. Air You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed. Earth You gain a burrow Speed of 10 feet. Fire You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed. Water You gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed and can breathe underwater.

heightened.desc: You also gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speeds.
The status bonus increases to +20 feet.

descs.value: You also gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speeds.
You also gain a +20-foot status bonus to your Speeds.

name: Embrace the Pit
shortDesc: Devil horns grow from your skull, and your skin takes on features of the devil responsible for your diabolic bloodline.
desc: Devil horns grow from your skull, and your skin takes on features of the devil responsible for your diabolic bloodline. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to evil, fire, and poison, and resistance <var>var2</var> to physical damage (except silver). You can take good damage, even if you aren't evil, and you gain weakness <var>var3</var> to good damage.

heightened.desc: The resistance to evil, fire, and poison increases by 5, the resistance to physical damage (except silver) by 2, and the weakness to good damage by 5.

name: Extend Spell
shortDesc: You call upon your blood's knowledge of the ancients to extend your magic.
inputRequired: The next spell you cast with a duration will last for 10 minutes, unless its duration is longer. Choose a suitable spell matching the description.
desc: You call upon your blood's knowledge of the ancients to extend your magic. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a duration of 1 minute and a single target, the spell instead lasts 10 minutes. You can extend a spell only if you cast it from a spell slot lower than your highest spell slot, and you can have only one active spell at a time extended in this way.

name: Fey Disappearance
shortDesc: You become invisible and ignore natural difficult terrain (such as underbrush).
duration: until the end of your next turn
desc: You become invisible and ignore natural difficult terrain (such as underbrush). <var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: If you use a hostile action, the invisibility doesn't end.

descs.value: Any hostile action you use ends this invisibility, but you still ignore natural difficult terrain.
If you use a hostile action, the invisibility doesn't end.

name: Horrific Visage
shortDesc: You briefly transform your features into the horrific visage of a hag, striking fear into your enemies.
desc: You briefly transform your features into the horrific visage of a hag, striking fear into your enemies. Foes in the area must attempt a Will save.
success: The foe is <var>var1</var>.
failure: The foe is <var>var2</var>.
critfailure: The foe is <var>var3</var>.
