heightened.desc: You can learn about an event that occurred within the last month.
You can learn about an event that occurred within the last year.
You can learn about an event that occurred within the last decade.
You can learn about an event that occurred within the last century.
You can learn about an event that occurred within the entirety of the object's history.

descs.value: the entirety of the object's history

name: Pass without Trace
shortDesc: Make your tracks hard to find.
desc: <var>var1</var>You obscure the tracks you leave behind and make it harder for others to find you. The DC of checks to Track you gains a +4 status bonus or is equal to your spell DC, whichever results in a higher DC. You can benefit from only one pass without trace spell at a time.

heightened.desc: The duration increases to 8 hours.
The duration increases to 8 hours. The spell has a range of 20 feet and an area of a 20-foot-emanation, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within that area.

descs.value: The spell has a range of 20 feet and an area of a 20-foot-emanation, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within that area.

name: Penumbral Shroud
shortDesc: You envelop the target in a shroud of shadow.
desc: You envelop the target in a shroud of shadow. The target perceives light as one step lower than it actually is (bright light becomes dim light, for example), affecting their ability to sense creatures and objects accordingly. The shroud also provides the target a +1 status bonus to saving throws against light effects. While this effect is helpful to creatures sensitive to light, if the creature is unwilling, it can attempt a Reflex save to avoid the shroud and reduce the effect.
success: The effect lasts for 1 round
failure: The effect lasts its normal duration.

name: Personal Rain Cloud
shortDesc: You conjure a 5-foot-wide rain cloud that follows the target wherever it goes.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On
desc: You conjure a 5-foot-wide rain cloud that follows the target wherever it goes. It stays roughly an arm's length overhead, unless it must drift lower to fit under a ceiling. The cloud rains constantly on the target, keeping it wet and dampening the ground in the wake of any movement. The rain extinguishes non-magical flames. The target gains fire resistance <var>var1</var>. Creatures with weakness to water take damage equal to their weakness at the end of each of their turns. Creatures can attempt a Reflex save to avoid the cloud.

heightened.desc: The amount of fire resistance increases by 2.

name: Pest Form
shortDesc: Turn into a nonthreatening animal.
desc:
You transform into a the battle form of a Tiny animal, such as a cat, insect, lizard, or rat. <var>var1</var>You can decide the specific type of animal (such as a rat or praying mantis), but this has no effect on the form's Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the animal trait. You can Dismiss the spell.

You gain the following statistics and abilities:

AC = 15 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
Speed 10 feet.
Weakness 5 to physical damage. (If you take physical damage in this form, you take 5 additional damage.)
Low-Light Vision and imprecise scent 30 feet.
Acrobatics and Stealth modifiers of +10, unless your own modifier is higher; Athletics modifier -4.

heightened.desc: You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.

descs.value: You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.

name: Phantom Pain
shortDesc: Cause a creature ongoing pain that sickens it.
desc: Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing |dice=var1 Mental + var2 Persistent Mental| <var>var1</var> mental damage and <var>var2</var> persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save.
success: The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.
failure: The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is sickened 1. If the target recovers from being sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.
critfailure: As failure, but the target is sickened 2.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

name: Protection
shortDesc: Shield a creature against those of a chosen alignment.
desc:
You ward a creature against a specified alignment. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful when you cast this spell. The target gains a +1 status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against creatures and effects of the chosen alignment. This bonus increases to +3 against effects from such creatures that would directly control the target and against attacks made by summoned creatures of the chosen alignment.

This spell gains the trait that opposes the alignment you chose - if you choose chaos, this spell gains the lawful trait, and vice versa; if you choose evil, this spell gains the good trait, and vice versa.

name: Purify Food and Drink
shortDesc: Make beverages and meals safe.
targets: 1 cubic foot of contaminated food or water
desc: You remove toxins and contaminations from food and drink, making them safe to consume. This spell doesn't prevent future contamination, natural decay, or spoilage. One cubic foot of liquid is roughly 8 gallons.

name: Ray of Enfeeblement
shortDesc: Sap a creature's strength.
desc: A ray with the power to sap a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save in order to determine the spell's effect. If you critically succeed on your attack roll, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.
success: The target becomes enfeebled 1.
failure: The target becomes enfeebled 2.
critfailure: The target becomes enfeebled 3.

name: Sanctuary
shortDesc: Protect a creature from being attacked.
desc: You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.
success: The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.
failure: The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.
critfailure: The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

name: Scouring Sand
shortDesc: You blast the area with grit that scours away soil and gets into creatures' eyes.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On
desc: <var>var1</var>You blast the area with grit that scours away soil and gets into creatures' eyes. For the duration of the spell, any plant-based difficult terrain smaller than a tree becomes loose, allowing each 5-foot square of it to be cleared with a single Interact action. In addition, scouring sand attempts to counteract entangle and other effects that create or manipulate plant-based terrain in its area. Successfully counteracting an effect removes only the portion of its area that overlaps with scouring sand's area. After one such attempt, the effect is temporarily immune to scouring sand's counteract for 24 hours. <var>var2</var>Each creature in the area when you Cast this Spell or that ends its turn in the area must attempt a Reflex save.
success: The creature is unaffected.
failure: The creature is dazzled for 1 minute or until it uses an Interact action to get the sand out of its eyes.
critfailure: As failure, but the creature is also blinded for its next action.

heightened.desc: Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a spot within range.
As the 3rd-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.

descs.value: Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a spot within range.
As the 3rd-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.
Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a spot within range.

name: Share Lore
shortDesc: You share your knowledge with the touched creatures.
desc: <var>var1</var>You share your knowledge with the touched creatures. Choose one Lore skill in which you are trained. The targets become trained in that Lore skill for the duration of the spell.

heightened.desc: The duration of the spell is 1 hour and you can target up to five creatures.
The duration of the spell is 8 hours, you can target up to five creatures, and you can share up to two Lore skills in which you are trained.

descs.value: The duration of the spell is 1 hour and you can target up to five creatures.
The duration of the spell is 8 hours, you can target up to five creatures, and you can share up to two Lore skills in which you are trained.

name: Shattering Gem
shortDesc: A large gem floats around the target in an erratic pattern.
desc: A large gem floats around the target in an erratic pattern. The gem has <var>var1</var> Hit Points. Each time a creature Strikes the target, the target attempts a DC 11 flat check. On a success, the gem blocks the attack, so the attack first damages the gem and then applies any remaining damage to the target. If the gem is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it shatters, immediately dealing the creature that destroyed it |dice=var2 S| <var>var2</var> slashing damage (basic Reflex save), as long as that creature is within 10 feet of the target.

heightened.desc: The gem has 5 additional HP, and the damage dealt by its detonation increases by 1d8.

name: Shillelagh
shortDesc: Make a club or staff temporarily magical, and deal more damage to unnatural creatures.
targets: 1 non-magical club or staff you hold
desc: The target grows vines and leaves, brimming with primal energy. The target becomes a +1 striking weapon while in your hands, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two. Additionally, as long as you are on your home plane, attacks you make with the target against aberrations, extraplanar creatures, and undead increase the number of weapon damage dice to three.

name: Shocking Grasp
shortDesc: Zap a creature with electricity.
desc: You shroud your hands in a crackling field of lightning. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes |dice=var1 Electricity| <var>var1</var> electricity damage. If the target is wearing metal armor or is made of metal, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll with shocking grasp, and the target also takes |dice=var2 Persistent Electricity| <var>var2</var> persistent electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage increases by 1.

name: Shockwave
shortDesc: You create a wave of energy that ripples through the earth.
desc: <var>var1</var>You create a wave of energy that ripples through the earth. Terrestrial creatures in the affected area must attempt a Reflex save to avoid stumbling as the shockwave shakes the ground.
success: The creature is flat-footed until the start of its next turn.
failure: The creature falls prone.
critfailure: As failure, plus the creature takes |dice=1d6| 1d6 damage.

heightened.desc: The area increases by 5 feet (to a 20-foot cone at 2nd level, and so on).

name: Sleep
shortDesc: Cause creatures in a small area to fall asleep.
desc: Each creature in the area becomes drowsy and might fall asleep. A creature that falls unconscious from this spell doesn't fall prone or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat.
success: The creature takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.
failure: <var>var1</var>
critfailure: <var>var2</var>

heightened.desc: The creatures fall unconscious for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall prone and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.

descs.value: The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

The creatures falls unconscious for 1 round. It falls prone and releases what it's holding, and it can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.

The creatures falls unconscious for 1 minute. It falls prone and releases what it's holding, and it can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.

name: Snowball
shortDesc: You throw a magically propelled and chilled ball of dense snow.
desc: You throw a magically propelled and chilled ball of dense snow. The target takes |dice=var1 Cold| <var>var1</var> cold damage and potentially other effects, depending on the result of your spell attack roll.
critsuccess: The target takes double damage and a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.
success: The target takes full damage and a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.
failure: No effect.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 2d4.

name: Soothe
shortDesc: Heal the target and bolster them against mental attacks.
desc: You grace the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> Hit Points when you Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

heightened.desc: The amount of healing increases by 1d10+4.

name: Spider Sting
shortDesc: Damage a creature and afflict it with spider venom.
desc: You magically duplicate a spider's venomous sting. You deal |dice=1d4| 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with spider venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. Spider Venom (poison); Level 1; Maximum Duration 4 rounds. Stage 1 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round); Stage 2 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round).
success: The target takes |dice=1d4 Poison| 1d4 poison damage.
failure: The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 1.
critfailure: The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 2.

name: Spirit Link
shortDesc: Continually transfer your health to someone else.
desc:
You form a spiritual link with another creature, allowing you to take in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve positive or negative energy, spirit link works even if you or the target is undead. While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, spirit link ends automatically.

heightened.desc: The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.

name: Summon Animal
shortDesc: Conjure an animal to fight on your behalf.
desc: You conjure an animal to fight for you. You summon a common creature that has the animal trait and whose level is <var>var1</var>.

shortDesc: Conjure a construct to fight on your behalf.
desc: You conjure a construct to fight for you. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the construct trait and whose level is <var>var1</var>.

name: Temporary Tool
shortDesc: You conjure a temporary simple tool, such as a shovel or rope into your hands.
PFSnote: The temporary tool spell can be used to create only simple tools, and therefore cannot create kits, which are complex objects made of multiple pieces, or objects made of any specific precious material.
duration: until used or 1 minute; see text
desc: You conjure a temporary simple tool, such as a shovel or rope into your hands. It lasts until it is used for a single activity or for 1 minute, whichever comes first, after which it disappears. The tool is obviously temporarily conjured, and thus can't be sold or passed off as a genuine item.

name: Tether
shortDesc: You use magical chains, vines, or other tethers to bind your target to you.
duration: 1 minute or until dismissed; see text
desc: You use magical chains, vines, or other tethers to bind your target to you. The creature can still try to Escape, and it or others can break the tethers by attacking them (the tethers have AC <var>var1</var> and <var>var2</var> Hit Points). You must stay within 30 feet of the target while it is tethered; moving more than 30 feet away from your target ends the spell. The target must attempt a Reflex save.
success: The target takes a -5-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed as long as it is within 30 feet of you.
failure: The target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed and cannot move more than 30 feet away from you until it Escapes or the spell ends.
critfailure: The target is immobilized until it Escapes or the spell ends.

heightened.desc: The tethers' AC increases by 3 and their Hit Points increase by 10.

name: True Strike
shortDesc: Make your next attack especially accurate.
duration: until the end of your turn
desc: A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being concealed or hidden.

name: Unseen Servant
shortDesc: Create an invisible creature to help you.
desc: You summon an unseen servant (Core Rulebook pg. 380), which you can command as part of Sustaining the Spell. It serves you until its Hit Points are reduced to 0, at which point the spell ends, or until you stop Sustaining the Spell. The unseen servant gains the summoned trait.

name: Ventriloquism
shortDesc: Throw your voice.
desc: Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. <var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.

descs.value: Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.

name: Verdant Sprout
shortDesc: You imbue a single ordinary, inexpensive plant seed with primal energy and throw it onto a surface, where it gradually sprouts into a Medium plant.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On
desc: You imbue a single ordinary, inexpensive plant seed with primal energy and throw it onto a surface, where it gradually sprouts into a Medium plant. After 10 minutes, the plant is sturdy enough to provide standard cover, and its space is difficult terrain. The plant is laden with nutritious nuts or fruit sufficient to feed one Medium creature for a day. The plant has AC 10, Hardness 5, and 20 Hit Points. <var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: You throw an additional seed, which grows into an additional plant within range.

descs.value: You can throw an additional seed, which grows into an additional plant within range.
You can throw two additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw three additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw four additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw five additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw six additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw seven additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw eight additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.
You can throw nine additional seeds, which grow into additional plants within range.

name: Acid Arrow
shortDesc: Magical arrow deals acid damage persistently.
desc: You conjure an arrow of acid that continues corroding the target after it hits. Make a spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal |dice=var1 Acid + var2 Persistent Acid| <var>var1</var> acid damage plus <var>var2</var> persistent acid damage. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.

heightened.desc: The initial damage increases by 2d8, and the persistent acid damage increases by 1d6.

name: Animal Form
shortDesc: Turn into a dangerous animal.
desc: You transform into a var1 animal battle form.var9 You can choose ape, bear, bull, canine, cat, deer, frog, shark, or snake. While in this form, you gain the animal trait. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of which battle form you choose: AC = var2 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction. var3 temporary Hit Points. Low-light vision and imprecise scent 30 feet. One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form you choose, which are the only attacks you can use. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is var4, and your damage bonus is var5. These attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the enfeebled condition, for example). If your unarmed attack bonus is higher, you can use it instead. Athletics modifier of var6, unless your own modifier is higher. You also gain specific abilities based on the type of animal you choose: Ape Speed 25 feet, climb Speed 20 feet; Melee fist, Damage var7d6 bludgeoning. Bear Speed 30 feet; Melee jaws, Damage var7d8 piercing; Melee claw (agile), Damage var8d8 slashing. Bull Speed 30 feet; Melee horn, Damage var7d8 piercing. Canine Speed 40 feet; Melee jaws, Damage var7d8 piercing. Cat Speed 40 feet; Melee jaws, Damage var7d6 piercing; Melee claw (agile), Damage var8d10 slashing. Deer Speed 50 feet; Melee antler, Damage var7d6 piercing. Frog Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet; Melee jaws, Damage var7d6 bludgeoning; Melee tongue (reach 15 feet), Damage var7d4 bludgeoning. Shark swim Speed 35 feet; Melee jaws, Damage var7d8 piercing; breathe underwater but not in air. Snake Speed 20 feet, climb Speed 20 feet, swim Speed 20 feet; Melee fangs , Damage var7d4 piercing plus 1d6 poison.

heightened.desc: You instead gain 10 temporary HP, AC = 17 + your level, attack modifier +14, damage bonus +5, and Athletics +14.

Your battle form is Large and your attacks have 10-foot reach. You must have enough space to expand into or the spell is lost. You instead gain 15 temporary HP, AC = 18 + your level, attack modifier +16, damage bonus +9, and Athletics +16.

Your battle form is Huge and your attacks have 15-foot reach. You must have enough space to expand into or the spell is lost. You instead gain 20 temporary HP, AC = 18 + your level, attack modifier +18, damage bonus +7 and double the number of damage dice, and Athletics +20.

descs.value: You must have enough space to expand into or the spell is lost.
+7 with double damage dice (including persistent damage). Your attacks have 15-foot reach
You must have enough space to expand into or the spell is lost.

name: Animal Messenger
shortDesc: Send a Tiny animal to deliver a message.
desc:
You offer a gift of food, and an ordinary Tiny wild animal within range approaches to eat it. You imprint the image, direction, and distance of an obvious place or landmark well known to you within the animal. Optionally, you can attach a small object or note up to light Bulk to it. The animal does its best to reach the destination; if it makes it there, it waits nearby until the duration expires, allowing other nonhostile creatures to approach it and remove the attached object. The spell ends after 24 hours or when a creature removes the attached object, whichever happens first.

If there are no Tiny wild animals in range, the spell is lost.

name: Animus Mine
shortDesc: You implant a mental mine within your psyche that detonates against anyone attempting to manipulate your thoughts.
desc:
You implant a mental mine within your psyche that detonates against anyone attempting to manipulate your thoughts. You can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to suppress the effects of the mine for 1 round to allow someone to safely use a mental effect on you. You can Dismiss the spell.

The first creature that uses a mental effect against you triggers the animus mine, causing the spell to end. The animus mine deals |dice=var1 Mental| <var>var1</var> mental damage to the triggering creature, which must attempt a Will save.
success: The creature takes half damage.
failure: The creature takes full damage and is stunned 1.
critfailure: The creature takes double damage and is stunned 1. You are unaffected by the triggering mental effect.

heightened.desc: The damage increases by 2d8.

name: Augury
shortDesc: Predict whether a course of action brings good fortune.
desc: You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveals the GM's best guess among the following outcomes: Weal The results will be good. Woe The results will be bad. Weal and Woe The results will be a mix of good and bad. Nothing There won't be particularly good or bad results. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.

name: Barkskin
shortDesc: Target's skin is covered in protective bark.
desc: The target's skin becomes covered in bark. The target gains resistance <var>var1</var> to bludgeoning and piercing damage and weakness <var>var2</var> to fire. After the target takes fire damage, it can Dismiss the spell as a free action triggered by taking the damage; doing so doesn't reduce the fire damage the target was dealt.

heightened.desc: The resistances increase by 2, and the weakness increases by 3.

name: Blur
shortDesc: Cause a target's form to become blurry and hard to hit.
desc: The target's form appears blurry. It becomes concealed. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target's location obvious, the target can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

name: Brand the Impenitent
shortDesc: You brand the target with an ethereal copy of your deity's religious symbol.
desc: You brand the target with an ethereal copy of your deity's religious symbol. This brand can't be hidden, but it is visible only to followers of your faith, who see it as clearly as a lit torch. Followers of your faith ignore the target's concealed condition, if any, and the target gains a -1 status penalty to AC against attacks by followers of your faith. If the target is a follower of your deity in good standing, the spell fails.
success: The spell lasts for 1 round.
failure: The spell lasts for 1 minute.
critfailure: The spell has an unlimited duration.

name: Breath of Drought
shortDesc: You fill the area with an oppressive, arid swelter that overwhelms creatures with heat exhaustion.
sourceBook: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On
desc: <var>var1</var>You fill the area with an oppressive, arid swelter that overwhelms creatures with heat exhaustion. Objects are unaffected. Each creature in the area when the spell is cast or that ends its turn in the area afterward must attempt a Fortitude save. Water creatures and plant creatures use the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their saving throw. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as fire elementals) are immune to breath of drought.<var>var2</var>
success: The creature is unaffected.
failure: The creature is sickened 1.
critfailure: The creature is sickened 2.

heightened.desc: Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a new location within range.
As the 4th-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.

descs.value: Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a new location within range.
The range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.
Once per round when you Sustain the Spell, you can move the center of the burst to a new location within range.

name: Calm Emotions
shortDesc: Suppress strong emotions and hostility.
desc: You forcibly calm creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.
success: Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.
failure: Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm emotions.
critfailure: As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

name: Comprehend Language
shortDesc: A creature understands one language.
desc: <var>var1</var>The target can understand the meaning of <var>var2</var>a single language it is hearing or reading when you cast the spell. This doesn't let it understand codes, language couched in metaphor, and the like (subject to GM discretion). If the target can hear multiple languages and knows that, it can choose which language to understand; otherwise, choose one of the languages randomly.

heightened.desc: The target can also speak the language.
You can target up to 10 creatures, and targets can also speak the language.

descs.value: You can target up to 10 creatures.

name: Continual Flame
shortDesc: A magical flame burns indefinitely.
desc: <var>var1</var>A magical flame springs up from the object, as bright as a torch. It doesn't need oxygen, react to water, or generate heat.

heightened.desc: The cost increases as follows: 16 gp for 3rd level; 30 gp for 4th, 60 gp for 5th, 120 gp for 6th,; 270 gp for 7th, 540 gp for 8th, 1,350 gp for 9th, and 3,350 gp for 10th.

name: Create Food
shortDesc: Conjure food that can feed multiple creatures.
desc: You create enough food to feed <var>var1</var> Medium creatures for a day. This food is bland and unappealing, but it is nourishing. After 1 day, if no one has eaten the food, it decays and becomes inedible. Most Small creatures eat one-quarter as much as a Medium creature (one-sixteenth as much for most Tiny creatures), and most Large creatures eat 10 times as much (100 times as much for Huge creatures and so on).

heightened.desc: You can feed 12 Medium creatures.
You can feed 50 Medium creatures.
You can feed 200 Medium creatures.

name: Darkness
shortDesc: Suppress all light in an area.
desc: You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.<var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as concealed.

descs.value: Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as concealed.

name: Darkvision
shortDesc: See in the dark.
desc: <var>var1</var>You grant yourself supernatural sight in areas of darkness. You gain darkvision.

heightened.desc: The spell's range is touch and it targets 1 willing creature.
The spell's range is touch and it targets 1 willing creature. The duration is until the next time you make your daily preparations.

descs.value: The spell's range is touch and it targets 1 willing creature.
The spell's range is touch and it targets 1 willing creature. The duration is until the next time you make your daily preparations.

name: Deafness
shortDesc: Make a creature deaf.
desc: The target loses hearing; it must attempt a Fortitude save. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.
success: The target is deafened for 1 round.
failure: The target is deafened for 10 minutes.
critfailure: The target is deafened permanently.

name: Death Knell
shortDesc: Finish off a creature who's near death.
desc: You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.
success: The target's dying value increases by 1.
failure: The target dies.

name: Dispel Magic
shortDesc: End a spell or suppress an item's magic.
targets: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item
desc: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you succeed against a spell effect, you counteract it. If you succeed against a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

name: Endure Elements
shortDesc: Protect a creature from severe cold or heat.
duration: until the next time you make your daily preparations
desc: You shield the target against dangerous temperatures. <var>var1</var>

heightened.desc: The target is protected from severe cold and heat.
The target is protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat.

descs.value: Choose severe cold or heat. The target is protected from the temperature you chose (but not extreme cold or heat).
The target is protected from severe cold and heat (but not extreme cold or heat).
The target is protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat.

name: Enhance Victuals
shortDesc: Improve food or drink and remove poisons.
targets: up to 1 gallon of non-magical water or up to 5 pounds of food
desc:
<var>var1</var>You transform the target into delicious fare, changing water into wine or another fine beverage or enhancing the food's taste and ingredients to make it a gourmet treat.

Prior to the transformation, the spell attempts to counteract any poisons in the food or water. The food turns back to normal if not consumed before the duration expires, though any poisons that were counteracted are still gone.

heightened.desc: The number of gallons of water you can target increases by 1, or the number of pounds of food you can target increases by 5.

descs.value: You can target up to 2 gallons of water and up to 10 pounds of food.
You can target up to 3 gallons of water and up to 15 pounds of food.
You can target up to 4 gallons of water and up to 20 pounds of food.
You can target up to 5 gallons of water and up to 10 pounds of food.
You can target up to 6 gallons of water and up to 30 pounds of food.
You can target up to 7 gallons of water and up to 35 pounds of food.
You can target up to 8 gallons of water and up to 40 pounds of food.
You can target up to 9 gallons of water and up to 45 pounds of food.

name: Enlarge
shortDesc: A creature grows in size.
desc: <var>var1</var>Bolstered by magical power, the target grows to size <var>var2</var>. Its equipment grows with it but returns to natural size if removed. The creature is clumsy 1. Its reach increases by <var>var3</var>, and it gains a <var>var4</var>. This spell has no effect on a <var>var5</var> or larger creature.

heightened.desc: The creature instead grows to size Huge. The status bonus to melee damage is +4 and the creature's reach increases by 10 feet (or 15 feet if the creature started out Tiny). The spell has no effect on a Huge or larger creature.
Choose either the 2nd-level or 4th-level version of this spell and apply its effects to 10 willing creatures.

descs.value: 5 feet (or by 10 feet if it started out Tiny)
10 feet (or 15 feet if the creature started out Tiny)
